CatDescriptText: Mr. Richard Felton, Rosenbaum's employee of the Fifth Ward, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 18, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think taverns should be permitted to remain open and dispense alcohol beverages until at least 2 A.M. Sundays? Do you favor the sale of beer and wine on Sundays in Pennsylvania, like some other states permit?" answer reads: "No, I believe that after 1 A.M. you are starting the Sabbath and this day should be started right.  And for the same reason, I'm against the sales of alcoholic beverages on Sunday."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Richard Felton wearing light colored t-shirt and light colored shirt, standing outside of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
